meanings.definition: To utter a soliloquy; talk to oneself.
meanings.sent1: She soliloquised in her room, expressing her innermost thoughts out loud.
meanings.sent2: He often soliloquised while walking alone in the park, lost in his own thoughts.
meanings.sent3: The cat soliloquised to itself while staring at a bird outside the window.
meanings.sent4: The old tree soliloquised to the wind, sharing its stories of centuries past.
meanings.sent5: The actor soliloquised on stage, captivating the audience with his emotional monologue.

meanings.definition: To speak one's thoughts aloud when by oneself or regardless of any hearers.
meanings.sent1: She soliloquised softly while reading her favorite book, lost in the story.
meanings.sent2: He often soliloquised while cooking, narrating his actions as if on a cooking show.
meanings.sent3: The child soliloquised to his toys, pretending they could understand his words.
meanings.sent4: The river soliloquised to the rocks, its babbling waters a constant chatter.
meanings.sent5: The student soliloquised during the exam, trying to remember the answers by speaking them out loud.
